item.description:
Want to learn how to make your own homemade yogurt? It's super easy. If you eat as much yogurt as I do, making your own makes great economic sense, and no more plastic containers!

This workshop will take participants through the yogurt-making process from start to finish - selecting milk, boiling, adding culture, the culture period, and jar process. Participants will also receive recipe and instruction cards to take home.

Folks will have the option of bringing their own mason jar, to take home a freshly made quart of homemade yogurt, with locally sourced farm milk.

We will conclude the evening by having a taste of some already-made yogurt with honey and yummy add-ins.

Cost: $10 for workshop. When you sign up, you will receive an email with instructions on how to pre-pay by check, and with the address of the workshop at my home in Waltham.

Â 

Questions? Contact Mindy Harris, Boston Sustainable Food Meetup Organizer and UHL Co-Admin

mindy.harris@rocketmail.com

310-663-0054.
item.name: Yogurtmaking Workshop
